# Awesome Claude Extensions

[![Awesome](https://awesome.re/badge.svg)](https://awesome.re)
[![License: MIT](https://img.shields.io/badge/License-MIT-yellow.svg)](https://opensource.org/licenses/MIT)

> A curated collection of specialized plugins and skills for Claude Code CLI, designed to enhance your development workflow with proven methodologies and best practices.

## üìã Table of Contents

- [Overview](#overview)
- [Quick Start](#quick-start)
- [Installation](#installation)
- [Available Plugins](#available-plugins)
- [Usage](#usage)
- [Contributing](#contributing)
- [License](#license)

## Overview

This repository provides production-ready skills that embody specific development methodologies and best practices. Each skill is thoroughly documented with philosophy, principles, code examples, and real-world usage patterns.

**What makes this different from other collections?**
- ‚úÖ **Methodology-driven**: Skills teach approaches, not just execute tasks
- ‚úÖ **Production-tested**: All skills are validated in real projects
- ‚úÖ **Comprehensive documentation**: Philosophy, principles, examples, and anti-patterns
- ‚úÖ **Language-agnostic**: Principles apply across technology stacks

## Quick Start

```bash
# Add this repository to your plugin marketplace
claude plugin marketplace add JohanSpannare/awesome-claude-extensions

# Install available plugins
claude plugin install pragmatic-tdd
claude plugin install prd-interview

# List installed plugins
claude plugin list
```

## Installation

The plugin marketplace provides automatic updates and easy management:

```bash
# Add this repository to your marketplace
claude plugin marketplace add JohanSpannare/awesome-claude-extensions

# View available plugins from this marketplace
claude plugin marketplace list

# Install specific plugins
claude plugin install pragmatic-tdd
claude plugin install prd-interview

# List installed plugins
claude plugin list
```

## Available Plugins

### Development Methodology

#### Pragmatic TDD
**Category:** Testing & Quality
**Description:** A comprehensive Test-Driven Development approach grounded in Hexagonal Architecture and Domain-Driven Design principles. This skill guides you through writing tests that verify business behavior rather than implementation details.

**Key Principles:**
- Test via primary ports, not internal details
- Mock only at adapter boundaries (external dependencies)
- Verify complete business flows, not isolated units
- Tests survive refactoring

**Best For:**
- Domain-rich business logic
- DDD/Hexagonal Architecture projects
- Teams prioritizing test maintainability
- Systems requiring high confidence in business rules

**[üìñ Read full documentation ‚Üí](./plugins/pragmatic-tdd/README.md)**

**Usage:**
```bash
/pragmatic-tdd
```

Or mention in conversation:
```
"Use the pragmatic TDD approach to implement user registration
with competitor domain detection. Test via the primary port
(UserRegistrationService) and mock only adapters."
```

---

## Usage

### Using Skills

Skills are activated by explicitly requesting them in your conversation with Claude:

#### Example 1: Starting a New Feature

```
You: "I need to implement a feature where users from competitor
domains are flagged for manual review. Use the pragmatic TDD
approach."

Claude: [Reads pragmatic-tdd skill documentation]
Claude: "I'll guide you through this using TDD. Let's start by
writing a test for the business requirement via the primary port..."
```

#### Example 2: Code Review with Methodology

```
You: "Review this UserService implementation using pragmatic
TDD principles. Are we testing at the right level?"

Claude: [Applies pragmatic-tdd principles]
Claude: "I notice these tests are mocking internal validators.
According to pragmatic TDD, we should test via the primary port
instead..."
```

#### Example 3: Refactoring Guidance

```
You: "I want to extract this competitor detection logic into
a separate class. Will it break tests?"

Claude: [References pragmatic-tdd principles]
Claude: "Since your tests are written via the primary port
(UserRegistrationService), this refactoring won't break them..."
```

### Plugin Scope

Plugins can be installed at different scopes:

- **User scope** (default): Available across all your projects
- **Project scope**: Install with `--scope project` for project-specific configuration

Use project scope when you want to version-control plugin configuration in your repository.

### Best Practices

#### For Individual Developers

```bash
# Add marketplace once
claude plugin marketplace add JohanSpannare/awesome-claude-extensions

# Install plugins you need
claude plugin install pragmatic-tdd
claude plugin install prd-interview

# Update all plugins when new versions are available
claude plugin marketplace update
```

#### For Teams

Add to your team's `CLAUDE.md`:

```markdown
# CLAUDE.md

## Required Plugins

This project uses the following Claude Code plugins:

```bash
claude plugin marketplace add JohanSpannare/awesome-claude-extensions
claude plugin install pragmatic-tdd@awesome-claude-extensions
claude plugin install prd-interview@awesome-claude-extensions
```

## Development Standards

All new features MUST:
1. Follow TDD via primary ports (use `/pragmatic-tdd` skill)
2. Mock only at adapter boundaries
3. Verify business flows end-to-end
4. Start with PRD using `/prd-interview` skill
```

## Contributing

We welcome high-quality contributions! See [CONTRIBUTING.md](./CONTRIBUTING.md) for detailed guidelines.

### Quick Contribution Guide

1. **Fork** this repository
2. **Create a skill** following our template (see CONTRIBUTING.md)
3. **Test** your skill in real projects
4. **Document** philosophy, principles, examples, and anti-patterns
5. **Submit** a Pull Request with clear description

### Quality Standards

All skills must include:

- ‚úÖ Concrete, runnable code examples
- ‚úÖ "Common Mistakes" section
- ‚úÖ "When to use / not use" guidelines
- ‚úÖ Real-world applicability (not toy examples)

**All documentation must be in English** (see [Language Policy](./CLAUDE.md#language-policy))

- **Pull Requests:** [Contribute your own skills](https://github.com/JohanSpannare/awesome-claude-extensions/pulls)

## Roadmap

- **Performance Optimization** - Profiling-driven optimization

Vote on priorities or suggest new skills in [Discussions](https://github.com/JohanSpannare/awesome-claude-extensions/discussions).

# PRD Interview Skill

Interactive interview to create comprehensive Product Requirements Documents.

## Philosophy

**Start with PROBLEM, not SOLUTION**

This skill ensures you understand WHY before discussing HOW, following proper product thinking:
- Problem ‚Üí Solution ‚Üí Implementation
- NOT: Solution ‚Üí Problem

## Installation

```bash
# Add the marketplace
claude plugin marketplace add JohanSpannare/awesome-claude-extensions

# Install the skill
claude plugin install prd-interview@awesome-claude-extensions
```

## Usage

In Claude Code, use any of these triggers:

```
/prd-interview
```

Or simply mention:
- "create a prd"
- "write product requirements"
- "help me plan a project"
- "interview me about my project"
- "create user stories"
- "define use cases"

## What It Does

Conducts a 14-step interview process:

1. **Read existing PRD** (if any)
2. **Understand the PROBLEM** (not solution!)
   - What problem?
   - Who has it?
   - How solving today?
   - Why important now?
   - What is success?
3. **Explore solution space** (with context)
4. **User Stories & Use Cases** (NEW!)
   - Define key user stories (As a/I want/So that)
   - Map out detailed use cases with flows
   - Acceptance criteria and priorities
5. **Define goals & success criteria**
6. **Technical deep dive**
7. **UI/UX** (if applicable)
8. **Architecture & scalability**
9. **Security & privacy**
10. **Testing & quality** (includes TDD approach)
11. **Risks & concerns**
12. **Trade-offs & decisions**
13. **Documentation needs**
14. **Generate comprehensive PRD**

## Example Flow

```
Q: What problem are you solving?
A: Team wastes 2h/day manually syncing data between 5 systems

Q: Who has this problem?
A: Our operations team (12 people)

Q: How are they solving it today?
A: Copy-pasting between Excel, Salesforce, custom DB

Q: Why is this important now?
A: Hiring 10 more people next month, this won't scale

Q: What does success look like?
A: Automatic sync, no manual work, data always consistent

--- NOW we explore solutions ---

Q: What type of solution fits best?
A: Backend API (now we understand WHY!)

Q: Have you considered alternatives?
A: Looked at Zapier but too expensive at scale

--- Technical details come LAST ---

Q: Tech stack in mind?
A: Must use Python (org requirement)

Q: Performance requirements?
A: Must handle 1000 req/sec
```

## Output

Generates comprehensive `PRD.md` with:
- Problem statement (what, who, why now)
- Current situation analysis
- Proposed solution (justified by problem)
- **User Stories** (As a/I want/So that format with acceptance criteria)
- **Use Cases** (Detailed scenarios with preconditions, main flow, alternative flows, postconditions)
- Technical requirements (with WHY for each choice)
- Architecture & scalability
- Security & privacy
- Testing strategy (including TDD approach if applicable)
- Risks & mitigation
- Trade-offs made
- Out of scope
- Success metrics
- Next steps

Plus suggestions for ADRs for key decisions.

## Why This Skill?

### Problem-First Approach

Unlike other PRD tools that start with "What are you building?", this starts with "What problem are you solving?" This ensures:
- Solutions are justified by real problems
- Technology choices are based on requirements, not preferences
- Clear success criteria from the start
- Better alignment with user needs

### Comprehensive Coverage

Covers all aspects:
- Business (problem, users, success)
- Technical (stack, architecture, performance)
- User experience
- Security & compliance
- Testing & quality
- Risk management
- Documentation

### Adaptable

- Conversational, not rigid questionnaire
- Adapts based on your answers
- Skips irrelevant sections
- Digs deeper on important topics

## Integration with Ralphy

Works seamlessly with [awesome-ralphy](https://github.com/JohanSpannare/awesome-ralphy):

1. **Create PRD** using this skill
2. **Document decisions** in ADRs (awesome-ralphy template)
3. **Structure work** using task templates (awesome-ralphy)
4. **Capture learnings** using learnings template (awesome-ralphy)

## Standards Compliance

This skill follows:

- **Agent Skills Best Practices**: [https://platform.claude.com/docs/en/agents-and-tools/agent-skills/best-practices](https://platform.claude.com/docs/en/agents-and-tools/agent-skills/best-practices)
- **Plugin Marketplace Distribution**: [https://code.claude.com/docs/en/plugin-marketplaces](https://code.claude.com/docs/en/plugin-marketplaces)
- **SKILL.md Format**: YAML frontmatter with proper triggers and metadata

## Version

# Pragmatic TDD Skill

A Claude Code skill that guides you through Test-Driven Development with pragmatic principles based on Hexagonal Architecture and Domain-Driven Design.

## What is This?

This skill teaches Claude to help you implement features using proper TDD methodology:
- Write tests FIRST, before implementation
- Test behavior, not implementation details
- Mock only at adapter boundaries
- Verify real business flows

## When to Use

Invoke this skill when you want to:
- Build features using test-driven development
- Implement domain-rich business logic
- Follow hexagonal architecture patterns
- Ensure tests survive refactoring

## Usage

Simply mention TDD in your conversation:

```
"Let's implement user registration using TDD"
"Write tests first for the order processing feature"
"Follow TDD approach for this feature"
```

Or explicitly invoke:
```
/pragmatic-tdd
```

## Philosophy

This skill follows a pragmatic approach to TDD:
- **Tests behavior, not implementation** - Tests survive refactoring
- **Minimizes test brittleness** - Focus on what code does, not how
- **Tests real flows** - Not isolated mock-based illusions
- **Follows Hexagonal Architecture** - Clear separation of concerns

## TDD Cycle

```
1. RED: Write test for behavior (via primary port)
   ‚îî‚îÄ> Test fails (function doesn't exist yet)

2. GREEN: Implement minimal domain logic
   ‚îî‚îÄ> Test passes

3. REFACTOR: Improve internal structure
   ‚îî‚îÄ> Tests remain green (they test behavior, not structure)
```

## Core Principles

### Test via Primary Ports
Test the system through its public API, not internal details.

### Mock Only at Adapter Boundaries
Mock external dependencies (database, HTTP, filesystem), never internal domain logic.

### Verify Business Flows
Tests should prove that business rules actually work, not just that code executes.

## Installation

This skill is part of the awesome-claude-extensions marketplace:

```bash
claude plugin marketplace add JohanSpannare/awesome-claude-extensions
claude plugin install pragmatic-tdd@awesome-claude-extensions
```

Or use the awesome-ralphy setup script which installs it automatically.

## Related

- [prd-interview](../prd-interview) - PRD creation with TDD considerations
- Hexagonal Architecture (Ports & Adapters)
- Domain-Driven Design (DDD)

## License

MIT
